intro: Alsodeia horsfieldii, commonly known as the Horsfield's alsike, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Alsodeia horsfieldii is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions.
